content.description: Sit start with opposing sidepulls, pull off the ground climb up and slightly right to link into Pizza the Hut and finish straight up at the highest point on the boulder.
content.protection: A couple of pads, it is pretty tall.
content.location: Start of this climb is in between the starts of the Warmup and Pocket problems, on the main face of the Black Hut boulder, it is a sit start, so it uses the lowest features on that face.

content.description: Start on the jug of Pizza the Hut but climb up and slightly right on crimps to a good topout.  Kind of squeezed in but a good line.
Start on the left edge of the main face. Good crystal left hand and friction patch for right. Move up right to a half moon edge, and fire up to incut pocket. Great stone.
Start on block jugs left of Fear of..climb up to sharp sharks tooth incut crimp. Continue straight to the top to the mental finishing crux.
Left of the main face, just under the huge roof. Find a square left sidepull, and a right friction patch. Establish and blast up smooth arete.
Climb the right most arete. Move up corner to a cool ear hold and a committing finish.
content.location: Right arete of the main face.

content.description: Left hand starts on good hold on arete roughly at head hight, right hand on thin side pull on the face, level with the left hand. Step your left foot up on to the arete, smear right, bump the left hand further up the arete to a good edge, readjust the right foot further up on the slab and then pop for the lip with the right hand. The lip is a little slopey, but not hard to match, after you've matched the lip traverse left and then top out just before you hit the arete.
content.location: Right arete of the boulder, around the arete from Fear of a Black Hut.

content.description: Stand start on the slab with two friction patches above head height, with two good edges for feet below you. Match feet and then trend left though several friction patches to reach the start of the real arete of the boulder, from here use low feet on the face to shift your weight over into the arete, there are a couple of ways to then shift over from the slab on the right side of the tree into the arete at the top of the boulder that starts in front of the tree. Once matched on the real arete, trend left along the lip and pull the same topout as carbonite arete just before the left arete of this face.
content.protection: Several pads, the top out is pretty tall and the crux of this problem is directly in front of the tree.
content.location: Right-most problem on the boulder, around the corner from Fear of a Black hut, the climb starts just to the right of the tree and trends left to top out at the top of that face of the boulder (as for Carbonite arete).

content.description: Start as for Fear and traverse left finishing up the Warmup Problem.
Start on an incut left of blocky jugs. Move up and then traverse left through cool incuts and sidepulls to topout.
One lone erratic amid all the quarries in the Black Hut wildlife management area in Burrivile RI. High quality granite, 18 ft tall with honest climbing to the top. Problems range from V2 to V9.
